skills.name: Calculate the square of a number
Calculate the square root of a number

explanations.A: 45 is not a square number. 6 squared is 36, what is the first square number after that?
explanations.B: 47 is not a square number. 6 squared is 36, what is the first square number after that?
explanations.C: 6 squared = 6 x 6 = 36. 7 squared = 7 x 7 = 49. So 49 is the first square number greater than 40.
explanations.D: 50 is not a square number. 6 squared is 36, what is the first square number after that?

explanations.A: 52 is not a square number. 7 squared = 49. What is the square number after this?
explanations.B: 55 is not a square number. 7 squared = 49. What is the square number after this?
explanations.C: 56 is not a square number. 7 squared = 49. What is the square number after this?
explanations.D: 7 squared = 7x7 = 49. The next square number is 8 squared = 8x8 = 64, so this is the first that is greater than 50.

explanations.A: I think you have just written the number two times in a row. 11² means 11 squared which is 11 x 11
explanations.C: I think you have multiplied by 2 rather than squaring. 11² means 11 squared which is 11x11
explanations.D: I think you have just written the power of 2 as a bigger 2 next to the 11. 11² means 11 squared which is 11x11

explanations.A: I think you have multiplied by 2 rather than squaring. 12² means 12 squared which is 12x12
explanations.B: I think you have just written the power of 2 as a bigger 2 next to the 12. 12² means 12 squared which is 12x12
explanations.D: I think you have just written the number two times in a row. 12² means 12 squared which is 12 x 12

explanations.A: This notation means 'divided by 2'. We are looking for the notation which means square root, the inverse operation of squaring a number.
explanations.B: This is the notation for the square root of x.
explanations.C: This is the notation for x squared. We are looking for the notation that shows the inverse operation, square root.
explanations.D: This is the notation for the cube root of x. We need the square root. How will this be different?

explanations.A: This is the notation for the cube root of x. We need the square root. How will this be different?
explanations.B: This is the notation for x squared. We are looking for the notation that shows the inverse operation, square root.
explanations.C: This is the notation for the square root of x.
explanations.D: This notation means 'divided by 2'. We are looking for the notation which means square root, the inverse operation of squaring a number.

explanations.A: I think you have just multiplied the digits together. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 36.
explanations.B: I think you have squared the number 36. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 36.
explanations.C: A square root is a number that when multiplied by itself, will give us the number we have. 6 X 6 = 36 so the square root of 36 is 6.
explanations.D: I think you have just doubled 36. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 36.

explanations.A: I think you have found the 4th root of 81. We need to find the number that when multiplied by itself makes 81.
explanations.B: A square root is a number that when multiplied by itself, will give us the number we have. 9 x 9 = 81 so the square root of 81 is 9
explanations.C: I think you have just doubled 81. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 81.
explanations.D: I think you have squared the number 81. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 81.

explanations.A: A square root is a number that when multiplied by itself, will give us the number we have. 10 x 10 = 100 so 10 is the square root of 100
explanations.B: I think you have just doubled 100. We are looking for the number that when multiplied by itself makes 100.
explanations.C: I think you have just divided 100 by 2. We need to find the number that when multiplied by itself makes 100.
explanations.D: I think you have squared 100 itself. We need to find the number that when multiplied by itself makes 100.

explanations.A: I think you have found the cube root of 64. We need to find the number that, when multiplied by itself, makes 64.
explanations.B: A square root is a number that when multiplied by itself, will give us the number we have. 8 x 8 = 64 so 8 must be the square root of 64
explanations.C: I think you have just halved 64. We need to find the number that, when multiplied by itself, makes 64.
explanations.D: I think you have squared 64 itself. We need to find the number that, when multiplied by itself, makes 64.
